column8: Answer3 Text

column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 2. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column8: Do not pass

column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 4. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: On the right curb.
Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 6. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column8: Always rely on

column2: 7. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 8. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
a requirement.

column2: 10. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column8: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.

column2: 11. If you have to wait for a space to enter a freeway, you should:
column4: maintain speed and signal other drivers to make a gap.
column6: slow down on the ramp and search ahead for a gap in traffic on the freeway.
column8: stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap in traffic.
Low clearance

column2: 13. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
Lane ends ahead

column2: 15. Which shape is a warning sign?
column8: Triangle

column4: triangular with black and yellow coloring.
column8: diamond or rectangular with orange and black coloring.
No U-turn
Stop ahead

column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
No U-turns

column2: 21. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
Road curves ahead

column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 24. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
column6: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column8: slow down to allow traffic to enter.

column2: 25. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: try to turn right before the bus does.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
